result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Ellis Lyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Curtis Ellis Lyon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Curtis Ellis Lyon was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 4:00 p.m. today June 25, 2015.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined within 30 days.
If no agreement Attorney Caton may request a Restitution Hearing with the Court Commissioner.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM95.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM95.
Psychological Evaluation at the Agents discretion.

-Domestic Abuse Assessment.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Cooperate with any correctional program as directed by Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Warrick, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton and DF: Curtis Ellis Lyon appeared. Case called at 11:55 am.   Atty Caton states an agreement. Atty Caton filed plea questionnaire w/the court. ADA Collins, states plea to count 1 and count 2 to be dismissed.  Victim is not present.  Def pleads guilty to count 1. S/T def. Def understands charges and possible penalties. Court finds the def freely, voluntarily and knowingly enters plea and waives rights. Crt finds factual basis. Court finds the def guilty to count 1. Count 2 dismissed. ADA Collins and Atty Caton state there is no agreement to restitution. Def makes statement to the court. 

Court orders:  S/W 1 year probation
Conditions:
- AODA and follow through with recommendations
- Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Follow all rules and regulations of DOC/Agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs as directed by DOC/Agent.
- Psychological eval at the agents discretion.
- Restitution to be determined w/in 30 days. If no agreement Atty Caton may request a restitution hearing with Court Commissioner.
- Court costs $243.00 - payable through Probation
- DNA surcharge $200.00 - payable through Probation

Report to probation no later than 4:00 pm today, June 25, 2015. 

Adjourned at 12:19 pm.

Case recalled at 2:07 p.m. CO: TCH for HWC, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, Curtis E. Lyon appears in person to discuss the 72 No Contact. Defendant to contact SSPD to go to the house to collect belongings.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jillian H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: TCH for HWC, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Curtis Ellis Lyon appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
